definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: You have to be very careful of traffic in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在北京的車流中你要非常小心。

sentences.english: Traffic was streaming down the grade, mostly big trucks in the righthand lane.
sentences.chinese: 下坡的路上車流如潮，大卡車大都行駛在右車道上。

sentences.english: On holidays, we can see a continuous line of cars on highways.
sentences.chinese: 在假期，我們能看到高速公路上連綿不斷的車流。

sentences.english: You're on your way somewhere, when suddenly you find yourself stuck in traffic.
sentences.chinese: 你正開着車前往某處，忽然發現自己被堵在車流中了。

sentences.english: At rush hour, there are many cars on the streets and traffic moves very slowly.
sentences.chinese: 在高峯期間，街道上車很多，因而車流非常緩慢。

sentences.english: When the traffic is too thick, they move into the opposite lane or mount the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 當車流太密，他們會逆向行駛或者駛入人行道。

sentences.english: Under the uniform traffic scenario in the establishment of vehicle to vehicle communications connectivity model.
sentences.chinese: 在均勻車流的場景下建立車車通信的連通性模型。

sentences.english: Edinburgh city reduces center traffic with pedestrian zones.
sentences.chinese: 中心開闢步行區來減少車流。
遠處若隱若現的車流喧囂。

sentences.english: At unsignalized intersection, many traffic collisions have relation with the left-turn traffic flows.
sentences.chinese: 無信號交叉口的許多交通衝突與左轉車流有關。

sentences.english: The instant feedback on the traffic flow enables me to choose an alternative congestion-free route.
sentences.chinese: 車流的及時反饋使我能選擇另一條不擁擠的路徑。

sentences.english: They just lurch out into traffic without batting an eye.
sentences.chinese: 他們就突然衝進車流中，眼睛都不眨一下。

sentences.english: Time-space network is a popular and effective method in research on dynamic railcar operation.
sentences.chinese: 時空網是研究鐵路動態車流組織的一種有效方法。

definition: to dredge/to open up a path for/to remove obstructions/to clear the way/to enlighten/persuasion
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides
to come and go/to have dealings with/to be in relation with
